intro: Platytheca crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are thick and succulent, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The flowers bloom in spring and are often used in gardens for their ornamental value.
